Article.ArticleTitle: Sesquiterpene dimers from the roots of Chloranthus holostegius with moderate anti-inflammatory activity.

AbstractText: Eight lindenane dimers, chololactones A-H, along with two known compounds, were isolated from the roots of Chloranthus holostegius. Their structures were elucidated using 1D/2D NMR and HRESIMS, and their absolute configurations were determined using the ECD exciton chirality method. All isolates were tested for inhibitory effects on the NO production of the liposaccharide (LPS)-induced RAW 264.7 macrophages, and showed moderate activity with IC<sub>50</sub> values at 3.5-35.4 μM.
